document.docAuthor: Bray, R. A., Waeschenbach, A., Dyal, P., Littlewood, D. T. J. & Morand, S.
document.docTitle: Biospeedotrema biospeedoi Bray, Waeschenbach, Dyal, Littlewood & Morand, 2014, n. sp.
document.masterDocTitle: New digeneans (Opecoelidae) from hydrothermal vent fishes in the south eastern Pacific Ocean, including one new genus and five new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New digeneans (Opecoelidae) from hydrothermal vent fishes in the south eastern Pacific Ocean, including one new genus and five new species

subSubSection.paragraph: urn:lsid:zoobank.org:act: 8381 CFB 8 - 5 EA 9 - 4 FD 7 -A 9 DE-A 161 B 7 C0E 664

Type host.
Thermichthys hollisi (Cohen, Rosenblatt & Moser)
(Ophididiiformes: Bythitidae ) , Hollis brosmekvabbe.

Type locality.
South East Pacific Rise, hydrothermal vent site Hobbs,
17 ° 35.20 ’S
,
113 ° 14.75 ’W
; Biospeedo cruise, PL 1588 , depth 2598 m , baited trap,
29 Apr.
Biospeedo labels: 1588 –3, 1588–6, 1588– 8 .

Type specimens.
MNHN holotype 1 slide MNHN HEL 391 , paratypes 6 wholemount slides MNHN HEL 392 393 394 395 396 397, 4 section slides. MNHN HEL 398 399 400 401 ; BMNH paratypes 2013.12.3.7- 10 .

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. This species is named after the Biospeedo expedition on which the material was collected

Testes lobate, symmetrical, separated by uterus, in anterior hindbody. Cirrus sac elongate claviform, reaching into hindbody, proximal extremity in sinistral anterior hindbody, curves dorsally to ventral sucker. Internal seminal vesicle saccular. Pars prostatica narrow, surrounded by gland-cells. Ejaculatory duct? Genital atrium small. Genital pore median to slightly submedian, just anterior to ventral sucker.

Ovary oval, between dextral testis and cirrus sac. Seminal receptacle uterine. Laurer’s canal opens dorsally in mid post-testicular region. Mehlis’ gland not clearly seen. Uterus mainly post-testicular but also intertesticular. Eggs large, operculate, tanned, few. Metraterm not clearly differentiated. Vitellarium follicular, follicles small, irregular, lateral fields reaching from anterior part of ventral sucker to anterior part of testes, confluent in narrow band dorsally to ventral sucker, lateral and dorsal to caeca.
Excretory pore terminal, to dorsally subterminal. Vesicle I-shaped, reaches between testes to ovary.

Remarks. In basic morphology this species is similar to
B . jolliveti
, but differs in being generally smaller. The vitelline fields are shorter, filling a smaller proportion of the body-length, and the cirrus sac is relatively larger (Table 1 ). The uterus tends to extend further posteriorly, relative to the testes. The morphological similarity between
B . jolliveti
and this species is also reflected in the molecular data; 1300 base pairs of lsrDNA differ only in two positions.

Biospeedotrema parajolliveti
differs in body-shape and the ratios of vitelline field length and ventral sucker size to body-length. The uterus tends to extend further posteriorly, relative to the testes.
